nodes.bodyText: It might help to define separation along the lines of being the minimum distance in chunks between structures
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,8 +1,29 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_5314 net/minecraft/world/gen/chunk/StructureConfig + COMMENT Contains parameters for placement of a single type of {@link net.minecraft.world.gen.feature.StructureFeature} during chunk + COMMENT generation. FIELD field_24917 CODEC Lcom/mojang/serialization/Codec; FIELD field_24918 spacing I + COMMENT Defines how many chunks make up one cell in the grid used to place structures. + COMMENT Each cell in the grid will receive one potential structure start. + COMMENT

+ COMMENT Minimum is 1, which means the structure will potentially be placed in every chunk. + COMMENT 2 leads to one structure per 2x2 chunks, and so on. FIELD field_24919 separation I + COMMENT Defines how varied the placement of a structure within the chunk grid (see spacing) is.

nodes.bodyText: I tried to improve this javadoc and also made a comment about it effectively being a margin that is subtracted from the width/height when actually placing the structure start.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,8 +1,29 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_5314 net/minecraft/world/gen/chunk/StructureConfig + COMMENT Contains parameters for placement of a single type of {@link net.minecraft.world.gen.feature.StructureFeature} during chunk + COMMENT generation. FIELD field_24917 CODEC Lcom/mojang/serialization/Codec; FIELD field_24918 spacing I + COMMENT Defines how many chunks make up one cell in the grid used to place structures. + COMMENT Each cell in the grid will receive one potential structure start. + COMMENT

+ COMMENT Minimum is 1, which means the structure will potentially be placed in every chunk. + COMMENT 2 leads to one structure per 2x2 chunks, and so on. FIELD field_24919 separation I + COMMENT Defines how varied the placement of a structure within the chunk grid (see spacing) is.

nodes.bodyText: Underscore sucks, but while it's private, Enigma won't let me name it the same as a field in the subclass.
